title.narrative: FAO resilience rapid respons Burkina Faso 2018-2020
FAO resilience rapid respons Burkina Faso 2018-2020

description.narrative:
Project name: "Réponse d’urgence et appui à l’amélioration de la résilience des populations vulnérables dans les zones à risque du Burkina Faso 2018-2020" ("Urgent response aiming at strengthening the resilience of vulnerabe households in risk zones in Burkina Faso 2018-2020")
Agreement partner and implementor: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), United Nations
Implementation period: 1 June 2018 - 31 May 2020
Amount of financial support by Sida: 79 000 000 SEK
Background:
In Burkina Faso, poor rainfall distributions in recent years have reduced the area of ??cereal crops and the income generated by agriculture. Large production deficits are recorded every year in some parts of the country, particularly the northern regions. The production of natural grazing is becoming weaker from year to year, causing animal feeding difficulties for livestock, especially during the period of March to June of each year.
Thus, the analysis of crop production in recent years shows an instability of food availability and nutrition in the whole country.
The 2017/2018 crop year was marked by prolonged pockets of drought, Fall Armyworm attacks in all parts of the country and grain-eating birds attacks in the Sahel, East and Boucle du Mouhoun regions.
The joint SAP-GTP mission in October 2017 counted 83 municipalities at risk. Thus, the current crop year 2017-2018 cereal production was estimated to have decreased with 11.65% compared to the last five years.
It is against this backdrop that the Government of Burkina Faso has developed a Plan of Emergency and Support to Vulnerable Populations for the year 2018. In addition to this, a Plan of Emergency and 2018 Resilience Initiative for Burkina Faso was developed by the UN System and its humanitarian partners in Burkina Faso.
The project will reach 10,000 poor and very poor households (according to the HEA classification) in the coverage regions, all of whom will benefit from the unconditional cash transfer during the lean season. In addition to unconditional cash transfer, 4100 self-selected households will have the opportunity to enroll in the «Cash for Work" activities (i.e. rehabilitation of communal infrastructures) during the mitigation and recovery period. Moreover, according to their main livelihoods, all households (HH) will receive productive assets: 2800 HH cereal production, 2500 HH small livestock restocking (sheep, goats, poultry, pigs depending on the choice), 1900 HH with livestock feed coupons and 2500 HH for market gardening coupled with nutritious gardens to strengthen their resilience. All targeted households (10 000) will also benefit from a nutritional education/sensitization programme.
The beneficiaries of the project will be identified on the already existing database relating to the socio-economic situation and the mapping of the various stakeholders.
Among the targeted beneficiaries, special emphasis will be placed on women and young people in order to take into account their specific needs.
Development objective:
The resilience of vulnerable pastoralists and agro-pastoralists to climate and economic shocks is improved.
Specific objectives:
1 Vulnerable households improve their access to food and livelihoods.
2 The livelihoods of vulnerable agro-sylvo-pastoral households in the provinces heavily affected by the crisis in Burkina Faso is reconstituted.
3 The nutritional condition of vulnerable households in provinces heavily affected by the crisis in Burkina Faso is improved.

Projektnamn: "Réponse d'urgence et appui à l'amélioration de la résilience des populations vulnérables dans les zones à risque du Burkina Faso 2018-2020" ("Akut svar för att stärka moståndskraften hos utsatta hushålli riskzoner i Burkina Faso 2018-2020" )
Avtalspartner och genomförare: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), FN
Genomförandeperiod: 1 juni 2018 - 31 maj 2020
Finansiellt stöd från Sida: 79 000 000 SEK
Bakgrund:
I Burkina Faso har den geografiskt och tidsmässigt ojämnt spridda nederbörden under de senaste åren minskat den uppodllade arealen och den inkomst som genereras av jordbruket. Stora produktionsunderskott registreras varje år i delar av landet, särskilt de norra regionerna. Foderproduktionen från naturliga betesmarker blir också svagare från år till år, vilket medför problem för boskap, särskilt under perioden mars till juni.
Tillgången på mat och näring har därmed blivit instabil i hela landet.
Odlingssäsongen 2017/2018 präglades av långvariga fickor av torka samt attacker av insekts i hela landet, och av fröätande fåglar angriper i Sahel, i öster och den västra regionen Boucle du Mouhoun.
Det gemensamma SAP-GTP-uppdraget i oktober 2017 klassade 83 kommuner i riskzonen. Det visades att skörden 2017-2018 minskade med 12% jämfört med de senaste fem åren.
Mot den bakgrunden har Burkina Fasos regering formulerat en nödplan för stöd till utsatta befolkningar för år 2018. Utöver detta togs fram en plan inom 2018 Resilience Initiative för Burkina Faso av FN: s system och dess humanitära partners i Burkina Faso.
Projektet kommer att nå 10 000 fattiga och mycket fattiga hushåll (enligt HEA-klassificeringen) i det täckta området, vilka alla kommer att dra nytta av överföringen av "unconditional cash" under "the lean season", dvs månaderna före skörd. Förutom "unconditional cash" kommer 4100 hushåll ha möjlighet att anmäla sig till aktiviteterna "Cash for Work" (dvs. rehabilitering av kommunala infrastrukturer) under höst och torrperiod. Dessutom kommer hushållens (HH) egna produktiva kapacitet att stärkas genom utdelning av "produktions-kits": 2800 kits för spannmålsproduktion, 2500 kits för uppfödning av boskap (får, getter, fjäderfä, grisar beroende på valet), 1900 HH får djurfoderkuponger och 2500 HH får stöd i grönsaksodling för att stärka nutrition och motståndskraft. Alla hushåll i målgruppen (10 000) kommer också att dra nytta av utbildning i nutrition.
Mottagarna (hushållen) kommer att identifieras i den existerande databasen över sårbara hushåll.
Bland mottagarna kommer särskild tonvikt läggas på kvinnor och unga och deras specifika behov.
Utvecklingsmål:
De sårbara pastoralisternas och agro-pastoralisternas motståndskraft mot klimat och ekonomiska chocker förbättras.
Specifika mål:
1 Sårbara hushåll förbättrar sin tillgång till mat och försörjning.
2 Egenförsörjningen hos sårbara agro-sylvo-pastorala hushåll i de provinser som drabbats hårt av krisen i Burkina Faso har återställts.
3 De sårbara hushållens nutrition i provinser som drabbats hårt av krisen i Burkina Faso har förbättrats.

Utvecklingsmål Motståndskraften mot klimatchocker och ekonomiska chocker hos sårbara boskapsskötare och agro-pastoralister har förbättrats Specifika mål 1 Sårbara hushåll har förbättrad tillgång till mat och försörjning 2 Försörjningsförmågan hos sårbara agro-sylvo-pastorala hushåll i krisdrabbade provinser har återställts 3 De sårbara hushållens näringsstatus i krisdrabbade provinser i Burkina Faso har förbättrats

description.narrative: - The report was delivered on time. - It is clear, well structured on the basis of the Results framework and easy to read. - Comments on last year's report regarding the need for more analysis and presenation of results have been taken into account. - It's positive to note that in spite of the deteriorated security situation, the great majority of the activities have been carried according to plan. - The project is on a good track and results seems likely to be achieved during 2020. - Increased collaboration with community organisations and rescheduling of activities have been the major mitigating measures against the worsening security situation. - With the contribution focusing to some extent on "nexus" activities (building resilience in vulnerable households through bridging between humanitarian and development support), it has been necessary to carefully coordinate activities with humanitarian actors, particularly the WFP. This seems to have been well done. - The contribution will most likely provide an important experience for the future formulation of "nexus" projects (projects dealing with both humanitarian and development issues, particularly in a contect of insecurity). - Coordination seems to have been efficient with other actors, much thanks to the coordination role of the government agency CT-CRSA, in charge of food security coordination in the regions. - The expansion from targeting 10,000 vulnerable households to 18,700 households (including 5,400 households of IDPs) seems to have been handled efficiently. - The delay of certain activities from 2019 to 2020 meant that households got support 4 to 10 months later than planned. This has prolonged suffering but coping mechanims seems to have worked well and there seems to have been no dramatic negative consequences. - Surveys among the targeted households show, on a positive note, that in 2019 households used indonditional cash support as well as cash for work for investments to a higher degree than in 2018. In other words, they seem to become more resilient. - It's also positive that the improved seeds distributed to vegetable gardens - mainly managed by women - have resulted in approximately 30% higher yield.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
